        • optn_alsoDiagonalNeighborsForClusterSearch

          boolean optn_alsoDiagonalNeighborsForClusterSearch
          Search also in cells diagonal to the current one for cluster members.

        • optn_singleInstanceJoinEnvironmentWidth

          int optn_singleInstanceJoinEnvironmentWidth
          Border width in grid cells around a single instance in which it can be joined to an existing cluster having more than one instance.

        • optn_maxClusterNum

          int optn_maxClusterNum
          Maximum number of clusters in the result.

        • optn_clusterCompareMode

          int optn_clusterCompareMode
          Compare mode to use for cluster comparison.

          In the current implementation there is only one cluster compare mode available. This setting is here to give the user a choice later, if more are added.

        • optn_distanceFunction

          weka.core.DistanceFunction optn_distanceFunction
          The distance function used for determining the distance between instances.

    • Class weka.clusterers.DBACluster extends weka.clusterers.RandomizableClusterer implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      7917723307771847875L

      • Serialized Fields

        • optn_alpha

          double optn_alpha
          Colony similarity coefficient alpha. The larger, the more similar the colonies must be.

        • optn_s

          double optn_s
          Size of the neighborhood. All instances within the range are regarded as neighbors of an instance.

        • optn_foiRaiseTolerance

          double optn_foiRaiseTolerance
          A raise of the local similarity value between two instances is not regarded as significant when not greater than this value.

        • optn_foiNoiseThreshold

          double optn_foiNoiseThreshold
          When the local similarity of an instance is below this value it is regarded as noise and not clustered. Set to -1 to not seek for noise instances.

        • optn_antsNum

          int optn_antsNum
          Number of ants.

        • optn_antsCallPerAntCycle

          int optn_antsCallPerAntCycle
          How many ants are called per ant cycle.

        • optn_antsMaxAntCycles

          int optn_antsMaxAntCycles
          How many ant cycles should be executed maximum.

        • optn_antsAssumeGlobalAfterNumCalls

          int optn_antsAssumeGlobalAfterNumCalls
          Ants assume that their observation is a global phenomenon when they saw it for this number of calls in series.

        • optn_distanceFunctionAlign

          boolean optn_distanceFunctionAlign
          This is a modifier to handle the distance calculation of difficult datasets in a different way. The distance is divided by the maximum distance in a neighborhood when set.

        • optn_distanceFunction

          weka.core.DistanceFunction optn_distanceFunction
          The distance function used for determining the distance between instances.

        • optn_maxClusterNum

          int optn_maxClusterNum
          The maximum number of clusters in the result. Set to -1 to not limit the maximum number of clusters.

        • optn_maxNumNeighborEvaluation

          int optn_maxNumNeighborEvaluation
          How many neighbor Instances are evaluated in the neighborhood maximum. It can speed up the algorithm a bit. Set to -1 to always evaluate the whole neighborhood.

        • optn_replaceMissing

          boolean optn_replaceMissing
          Replace missing values globally?

        • data

          weka.core.Instances data
          Instances data to be clustered.

        • antHill

          DBACluster.AntHill antHill
          Ant colony of ants.

        • out_clusterAssignments

          int[] out_clusterAssignments
          Assignments of the most recently clustered gridInstances to clusters.

        • out_antCycles

          int out_antCycles
          How many ant cycles were executed.

        • out_atAntCycleExecutionLimit

          boolean out_atAntCycleExecutionLimit
          Were as many ant cycles executed as allowed or less?

        • out_maxNeighborhoodSize

          int out_maxNeighborhoodSize
          Size of the largest neighborhood during last execution.

        • out_numUnclustered

          int out_numUnclustered
          How many instances remained unclustered.

        • replaceMissingValuesFilter

          weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.ReplaceMissingValues replaceMissingValuesFilter
          Replace missing values filter.

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand
          Random number generator.

    • Class weka.clusterers.LFCluster extends weka.clusterers.RandomizableClusterer implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      -3955155847797759076L

      • Serialized Fields

        • optn_alpha

          double optn_alpha
          Colony similarity coefficient alpha. The larger, the more similar the colonies must be.

        • optn_kp

          double optn_kp
          Pick up threshold constant. Used for adjusting the pick up probability. Must be greater than 0.

        • optn_kd

          double optn_kd
          Drop down threshold constant. Used for adjusting the drop down probability.

        • optn_kdFunction

          int optn_kdFunction
          Which kd function should be used.

        • optn_distanceFunction

          weka.core.DistanceFunction optn_distanceFunction
          The distance function used for determining the distance between instances.

        • optn_gridSizeX

          int optn_gridSizeX
          Width of the grid.

        • optn_gridSizeY

          int optn_gridSizeY
          Height of the grid.

        • optn_antCycles

          int optn_antCycles
          Maximum number of ant cycles to be executed.

        • optn_antsCallPerAntCycle

          int optn_antsCallPerAntCycle
          How many ants should be called in one ant cycle.

          For each call an ant is selected randomly. An ant cycle is done when there are as many ants called as specified here. As the selection of an ant is random, an ant can also be called several times in the same ant cycle, whereas other ants may not be called during one ant cycle.

        • optn_antsNum

          int optn_antsNum
          Number of ants on the grid.

        • optn_antsViewRange

          int optn_antsViewRange
          Size of the view range of ant ant or neighborhood radius s on the grid.

          All instances within the radius are regarded as neighbors. The ant view range is measured in grid cells surrounding one ant. It has the shape of a square. When the ant view range is 0, the ant view range is limited to the grid cell the ant sits on. As this does not lead to clustering the ant view range must be at least 1.

        • optn_antsSpeedDistributionLimit

          int optn_antsSpeedDistributionLimit
          Maximum ant speed, how many steps an ant can make on the grid in one turn.

          A step means an ant is going from one grid cell to a neighbor grid cell, diagonal cells not included. When this value is greater than 1, ants can have different speeds. For example, if the speed distribution limit is 10, there are 10 groups of ants with the speeds 1,2,..,10. The clusterer tries to keep the groups of equal size, although this is not possible when the division of ant count / speed distribution limit has a rest. In this case the ant speed groups do not all have the same size.

        • optn_antsDropRange

          int optn_antsDropRange
          The ant drop range is the area in which ants can drop instances they carry.

          It is measured in grid cells surrounding an ant, so that the area has the shape of a square. When the ant drop range is 0, the ant can drop the instance it carries only at its position and if there is no instance yet. In other cases the ant drops the instance to a random and free grid cell in this as soon as the ant decided to drop its carried instance.

        • optn_antsDropMemorySize

          int optn_antsDropMemorySize
          Number of drop locations an ant can remember.

          The ant will remember its recent drop locations and when it picks up a new instance it checks its memory and retrieves the instance that is most similar to the instance picked up just now. Then the ant goes in the direction to where it dropped the memorized instance. As soon the ant reaches the memorized location it starts walking randomly again, no matter if it dropped the instance there or not. When the ant picks up another instance the process starts again. Ants do not have a drop location memory when this option is set to -1.

        • optn_antsBehaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles

          int optn_antsBehaviorDestructiveAfterNumFreeCycles
          After how many ant cycles carrying nothing the ant switches to destructive behavior.

          When an ant did not pick up an instance for the given amount of ant cycles it becomes destructive and picks up the next instance regardless of the neighborhood of the instance. Set to -1 to deactivate this behavior.

        • optn_antsBehaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps

          int optn_antsBehaviorDestructiveForNextPickUps
          How many times an ant will pick up an instance in destructive behavior before the ant switches back to normal pick up behavior.

          Destructive pick up behavior means the ant picks up instances regardless of the instance environments, therefore the ant does not care if it destroys clusters of already grouped instances. After an ant picked up enough instances in that behavior it turns back to normal pick up behavior again. This value determines how many instances the ant wants to pick up without caring for the instance environment, before it switches back to normal behavior. When this value is -1, the ant remains destructive.

        • optn_replaceMissing

          boolean optn_replaceMissing
          Replace missing values globally?

        • optn_gridClusterer

          weka.clusterers.Clusterer optn_gridClusterer
          Clusterer that is used to explain the clusters (instance groups) on the grid.

        • alpha

          double alpha
          The current alpha value.

        • data

          weka.core.Instances data
          Instances to be clustered.

          This variable holds the given Instances object, which contains all Instance objects to be clustered. This variable is best understood as a global variable and once the Instances are assigned, it must not be altered anymore. Other classes of this clusterer rely on the contents of this variable and expect that this variable is available.

          See Also:
          Instances

        • grid

          LFCluster.Grid grid
          Grid on which the instances are distributed, clustered and where the ants run.

        • ants

          LFCluster.Ant[] ants
          Ants to be used.

        • antCycles

          int antCycles
          Number of ant cycles that were already executed.

        • replaceMissingValuesFilter

          weka.filters.unsupervised.attribute.ReplaceMissingValues replaceMissingValuesFilter
          Replace missing values filter.

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand
          Random number generator.

        • out_clusterAssignments

          double[] out_clusterAssignments
          Assignments of the most recently clustered gridInstances to clusters.

        • out_gridClustererResults

          java.lang.String out_gridClustererResults
          String output of the used gridClusterer.
